meanings.definition: To envelop or surround in a protective or comforting way.
meanings.sent1: She was cocooning herself in a warm blanket on the couch.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar was cocooning itself in silk to become a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The baby bird was cocooning in its nest, feeling safe and cozy.
meanings.sent4: The fog cocooning the city made everything seem mysterious and hidden.
meanings.sent5: The mother cocooned her child in a tight hug, shielding them from the world.

meanings.definition: The practice of staying at home and avoiding social interactions.
meanings.sent1: During the winter, she enjoyed cocooning at home with a good book.
meanings.sent2: Cocooning has become more common as people seek comfort in familiar surroundings.
meanings.sent3: His cocooning tendencies led to some hilarious misunderstandings with his friends.
meanings.sent4: The cocooning of the introverted artist was broken by a sudden burst of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The cocooning of the city during the storm created a sense of unity among neighbors.
